greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponent of the group of the Eisenstein integers in a reduced system modulo n.
comment: Equivalent of psi (A002322) in the ring of Eisenstein integers.

a(n) is the exponent of the multiplicative group of Eisenstein integers modulo n, i.e., (Z[w]/nZ[w])* = {a + b*w : a, b in Z/nZ and gcd(a^2 + a*b + b^2, n) = 1} where w = (1 + sqrt(3)*i)/2. The number of elements in (Z[w]/nZ[w])* is A319445(n).
a(n) is the smallest e such that for any Eisenstein integer z coprime to n we have z^e == 1 (mod n).

By definition, A319445(n)/a(n) is always an integer, and is 1 iff (Z[w]/nZ[w])* is cyclic, that is, rank((Z[w]/nZ[w])*) = A319447(n) = 0 or 1, and n has a primitive root in (Z[w]/nZ[w])*. A319445(n)/a(n) = 1 iff n = 1, 3 or a prime congruent to 2 mod 3.
For n > 2, a(n) is divisible by 6.
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(3) = 6, a(3^e) = 2*3^(e-1) for e >= 2; a(p^e) = (p - 1)*p^(e-1) if p == 1 (mod 3) and (p^2 - 1)*p^(e-1) if p == 2 (mod 3). If gcd(m, n) = 1 then a(mn) = lcm(a(m), a(n)).
example: Let G = (Z[w]/4Z[w])* = {1, w, 1 + w, w', 1 + w', -1 + 2w, -1, -w, -1 - w, -w', -1 - w', -1 + 2w'}. The possibilities for the exponent of G are 12, 6, 4, 3, 2 and 1. G^6 = {x^6 mod 4 : x belongs to G} = {1} and w^3 !== 1 (mod 4), w^4 !== 1 (mod 4). Therefore, the exponent of G is greater than 4, accordingly the exponent of G is 6 and a(4) = 6.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := If[p == 3 , If[e == 1, 6, 2*3^(e - 1)], Switch[Mod[p, 3], 1, (p - 1)*p^(e - 1), 2, (p^2 - 1)*p^(e - 1)]]; eisPsi[1] = 1; eisPsi[n_] := LCM @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[eisPsi, 100]  (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 10 2020 *)
xref: Equivalent of arithmetic functions in the ring of Eisenstein integers (the corresponding functions in the ring of integers are in the parentheses): A319442 ("d", A000005), A319449 ("sigma", A000203), A319445 ("phi", A000010), this sequence ("psi", A002322), A319443 ("omega", A001221), A319444 ("Omega", A001222), A319448 ("mu", A008683).
Equivalent in the ring of Gaussian integers: A227334.
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Sep 19 2018
